title: Matías Díaz
text:
Matías Díaz (born 16 March 1993 in <a href="Mendoza%2C%20Argentina">Mendoza</a>) is an <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays mostly in the <a href="Prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">Tight head prop</a> position. He currently plays with the New Zealand team <a href="Highlanders%20%28rugby%20union%29">Highlanders</a> in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a>.
He was called up by <a href="Rodolfo%20Ambrosio">Rodolfo Ambrosio</a> into the <a href="Argentina%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina under-20 side</a> for the <a href="2012%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2012 IRB Junior World Championship</a>, and kept his position for the <a href="2013%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2013 IRB Junior World Championship</a>.
Díaz made his debut for the senior side in 2013 against eventual runners-up <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a> in the <a href="2013%20South%20American%20Rugby%20Championship%20%26quot%3BA%26quot%3B">2013 South American Rugby Championship "A"</a>. Despite only being capped three times (all from the <a href="South%20American%20Rugby%20Championship">two-tiered competition</a>), Díaz was named in the 30-man squad for the <a href="2013%20Rugby%20Championship">2013 Rugby Championship</a>.
He was initially named in Argentina's squad for the <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2015 Rugby World Cup</a> but then was immediately replaced by <a href="Juan%20Pablo%20Orlandi">Juan Pablo Orlandi</a> after getting injured.
